newsitem.title: CANADA: Stone-Consolidated plans more plant downtime.
newsitem.headline: Stone-Consolidated plans more plant downtime.

text.p: Stone-Consolidated Corp said on Tuesday that it planned to take further temporary downtime at six of its seven North American mills to adjust inventory imbalances.
The shutdowns represent 25,000 metric tons of uncoated groundwood paper production, bringing the total since January 1 to 95,500 tonnes.

Additional temporary shutdowns at its newsprint mills represent a loss of production of 24,000 tonnes, in addition to newsprint production reductions of 128,000 tonnes already announced since January 1.
The loss of newsprint production for the year does not include 22,000 tonnes lost at the Port-Alfred mill in La Baie, Quebec because of flooding in July.
